phrases.phrase: Options for the Tabs by Waindigo add-on.
Tab names can be created and edited here.
Tab names can be created and edited here.
Tab names can be created and edited here.
Tab names can be created and edited here.
Tab names can be created and edited here.
Tab names can be created and edited here.
For larger sites, it is better to allow users to just enter the URL of the content they want to add rather than giving them large drop-down boxes to choose form.
You may not add a tab from a content item to itself.

{username} started a conversation:
[url={contentLink}]{title}[/url]
[quote]{snippet}[/quote]
[url={contentLink}]Read more of this conversation...[/url]
Please confirm that you want to delete the following tab name
Please confirm that you want to delete the following tab rule
Please confirm that you want to delete the following tab
The requested tab name could not be found.
The requested tab could not be found.
The requested tab rule could not be found.
There are no options for this content type.

{username} posted a new thread:
[url={contentLink}]{title}[/url]
[quote]{snippet}[/quote]
[url={contentLink}]Read more of this thread...[/url]
You may only select a content item that already has tabs.

templates.template: {xen:phrase waindigo_add_tab_to_x_tabs, 'title={$title}'}

<xen:if is="{$tabNames}"> <fieldset> <dl class="ctrlUnit"> <dt><label for="ctrl_tab_name_id">{xen:phrase waindigo_tab_name_tabs}:</label></dt> <dd> <select name="tab_name_id" class="textCtrl" id="ctrl_tab_name_id"> <xen:foreach loop="$tabNames" key="$tabNameId" value="$_tabName"> <option value="{$tabNameId}" {xen:selected '{$tabNameId} == {$content.tab_name_id}'}>{$_tabName.title}</option> </xen:foreach> </select> </dd> </dl> </fieldset> </xen:if>
{xen:raw $tab.template}

modification.description: Adds tab create templates to new conversation page.
Adds tab name editor to conversation editor.
Copyright notice for Tabs by Waindigo
Adds tab name editor to resource editor.
modification.replace:
<xen:if is="{$tabCreateTemplates}"> <xen:require js="js/waindigo/tabs/existing_tab.js" /> <xen:require css="waindigo_select_existing_tabs.css" /> <xen:foreach loop="$tabCreateTemplates" value="$tabCreateTemplate"> {xen:raw $tabCreateTemplate} </xen:foreach> </xen:if>
<xen:include template="waindigo_edit_tab_name_tabs"> <xen:map from="$resource" to="$content" /> </xen:include>
${0}

modification.description: Adds tab create templates to thread create page.
Adds tab name editor to thread editor.
Adds tab create templates to add media page.
